# alkira_peering_gateway_cxp (Data Source)

This data source allows to retrieve an existing Cxp Peering Gateway by its name or ID.

## Example Usage

```terraform
# Lookup by name
data "alkira_peering_gateway_cxp" "by_name" {
  name = "my-peering-gateway"
}

# Lookup by ID (useful when ID is auto-generated from a connector)
data "alkira_peering_gateway_cxp" "by_id" {
  id = 12345
}

# Example: Using auto-generated peering_gateway_cxp_id from a connector
resource "alkira_connector_azure_vnet" "example" {
  name              = "example-connector"
  azure_vnet_id     = "/subscriptions/xxx/resourceGroups/xxx/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/xxx"
  credential_id     = "credential-id"
  cxp               = "US-WEST"
  segment_id        = "segment-id"
  # peering_gateway_cxp_id will be auto-populated by the API
}

data "alkira_peering_gateway_cxp" "from_connector" {
  id = alkira_connector_azure_vnet.example.peering_gateway_cxp_id
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Optional

- `id` (Number) The ID of the resource.
- `name` (String) The name of the resource.

### Read-Only

- `cloud_provider` (String) The cloud provider where this resource is created.
- `cloud_region` (String) The region of the specified cloud provider.
- `cxp` (String) The CXP to which the Gateway is attached.
- `description` (String) Description of the resource.
- `metadata` (List of Object) Metadata information available once the Peering Gateway is in ACTIVE state. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--metadata))
- `segment_id` (String) The ID of the segment that is associated with the resource.
- `state` (String) The state of the resource.

<a id="nestedatt--metadata"></a>
### Nested Schema for `metadata`

Read-Only:

- `guest_email` (String)
- `ilb_ip_address` (String)
- `resource_group` (String)
- `subscription_id` (String)
- `vnet_name` (String)
- `vnet_resource_id` (String)
